body_html:
Isn't the hasattr(self, name) check is superfluous in case of a Tensor?
self.blah = Variable(torch.Tensor(10, 10)) is not handled by Module.__setattr__() in any explicit way, so it shouldn't interfere with register_buffer()

Seems to me that the precondition for register_buffer needs to be that tensor is an instance of Tensor and that's it.

body:
Isn't the `hasattr(self, name)` check is superfluous in case of a Tensor?
`self.blah = Variable(torch.Tensor(10, 10))` is not handled by `Module.__setattr__()` in any explicit way, so it shouldn't interfere with `register_buffer()`

Seems to me that the precondition for register_buffer needs to be that tensor is an instance of Tensor and that's it.
